questions.question_text:
Universal Containers allows all employees to submit reviews for leadership using a custom object. These reviews should only be visible to the HR department and the employee who submitted the review.
Which three steps should an app builder take to properly control access to review records? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: Correct answers are C D E

comments.content:
C - review should be visible only for the Owner and HR
D - if it is checked then roles from hierarchy above would be able to see reviews
E - share reviews with HR

discussion.content: Why not C,D,E?

Selected Answer: CDE
C. OWD = Private-✅ Set-Prevents others from seeing reviews by default
D. Disable Access via Hierarchies-✅ Disable-Stops managers from seeing employee-submitted reviews
E. Share with HR-✅ Create Sharing Rule-Allows HR to see all reviews

Answers: CDE

Not A: https://www.saasguru.co/what-is-owd-in-salesforce/

Private: With this setting, only the record owner and users higher up in the role hierarchy can access the records, making it the most restrictive option. 

Not B: https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.object_reference.meta/object_reference/relationships_among_objects.htm
 And you can’t create a master-detail relationship where these standard objects are the primary object.

Selected Answer: CDE
answers are C D E

Option D is incorrect: 
Disable Grant Access Using Hierarchies is not correct because it would not have any impact on controlling access to the Reviews object.

Disabling "Grant Access Using Hierarchies" only controls whether users can gain access to records through their role in the role hierarchy. This setting does not control access to records through sharing rules or explicit sharing. If this setting is enabled, a user can gain access to records owned by or shared with a user higher in the role hierarchy. If it is disabled, a user can only access records that are explicitly shared with them or that they own.

So, disabling "Grant Access Using Hierarchies" is not related to the requirement of controlling access to the Reviews object for HR department and the employee who submitted the record.
Option B is outrightly incorrect. 
I would choose correct answers as: A, C, E

comments.content: But in this case, people above HR department on Hierarchy will be able to see the records too. And the question says that ONLY HR department and the employee who submitted the review should be able to see. Then C,D,E

To manage and evaluate all of these changes in a single save operation, an app builder wants to use Process Builder and the Advanced option to let the process evaluate a record multiple times has been selected.
What option should the App Builder avoid to prevent recursion?

discussion.content:
A&D are correct

we recommend not setting any of your criteria to No criteria—just execute the actions!.

We recommend that you don’t use the advanced options if your process uses ISCHANGED, ISNEW, or PRIORVALUE formula functions.

questions.question_text:
Sales Managers want to be automatically notified any time there is a change to an Opportunity Close Date and want these changes to be tracked on the
Opportunity.
Which two configurations should an app builder recommend? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
D is essential for both tracking and immediate notifications.
B can provide notifications, also Automatically detects a change to notify unlike D.
A provides tracking only. - A is more like analysis of the data for reporting, captures snapshot not realtime like D

Selected Answer: BD
It can be A, but you must define a criteria, and there is no operator "is changed" at Historical Trending

Selected Answer: AB
According to know what is gona happen with a field (just a notification), the best practice is feed tracking, but if you what to track values of a field in a useful maner, please use Historical Trending. You will be able to draw a chart based on the field evolution. Chatter feed will never show you evolution like Hist-Trend which is a report toolbox.
B and D looks correct.
